TopicTitle: Don't Kerbals on EVA count technically as craft

Articles.Content:
I'm just asking since you know how you can track Kerbals the same way you track craft; I was thinking that the game treats Kerbals as craft and that's why they are trackable.

 

I just don't want to sound like a idiot or worse, a noob idiot.
Yes, IIRC they actually are treated as craft in the game.
Everything you can attach a claw to is a craft. Asteroids, Kerbals, the landing gear that broke off your SSTO and is now orbiting Minmus...

Heheheh, yeah. <Stuff> happens; like you losing your landing legs and forcing yourself to land on your side and be stranded forever on the Mun. (True story back in 0.17)

Keep the language in check, please.

36 minutes ago, FirstSecondThird said:

Heheheh, yeah. Sh*t happens; like you losing your landing legs and forcing yourself to land on your side and be stranded forever on the Mun. (True story back in 0.17)

I had an interesting experience with that a few days ago... I was landing the final component (crew quarters and greenhouse) of a multi-part surface outpost on Minmus, but I overcorrected and the whole module tipped over and landed on its side. It was pretty massive, and didn't have the torque to right itself again. I was afraid I'd have to send a skycrane to pick it up and put it on its feet... but then I remembered that I had a couple of engineers on site, and that I play with KIS/KAS! Using my high-level knowledge of Newtonian physics, I sent one of the engineers to remove some of the RCS maneuvering jets and bolt them back on much further from the center of mass, strategically placed in exactly the right spot to provide maximum torque in the correct direction. With that, the module was easily able to push itself back upright and successfully complete the outpost. Hooray for physics!

If you think about it, it's not the kerbals themselves that are the craft, but their spacesuits with attached EVA gear that makes for the craft, with the kerbal still being the operator/pilot. And as long as they are out in the field, as in anywhere that's not inside the Astronaut Complex, they will be wearing their suit.

Gets me to imagining a kerbal spacesuit with an OKTO drone sitting inside the helmet for doing unkerballed EVA missions.
